How to find us - by Rail
You are here: How to find us >

column2: All Saints is situated approximately 1 mile from Horsforth station on the Leeds-

column1: Harrogate line. Leeds is well served by suburban rail lines and stations and it is easy to
travel in or out of the city centre by train.
Telephone 08457 484950 for information or any enquiries you have about UK rail services
(calls charged at local call rates between 8.00am - 8.00pm Monday to Saturday and
Horsforth station has recently had a &pound
purchase a full range of rail tickets from a staffed ticket office and can wait for trains in
fully accessible, heated waiting rooms on both platforms.
Directions from the station to the College: The campus is 10 &ndash
column2: 15 minutes walk   away from the station. On leaving the station, turn right,   walking past a parade of shops to your right, until you reach a roundabout and   the Old Ball pub. Turn right onto Brownberrie Lane (Trinity &amp
column3: All Saints   is signposted) and continue (you will pass the cricket club on your left) until   you see Trinity &amp
column4: All Saints on your left hand side. (Download map)

column1: on the Leeds - Harrogate line stop at Horsforth Station
(1 mile). Alternatively you may wish to take a taxi from
Leeds City Station direct to the College (6 miles)
to Metro website for timetable information
GNER services run to and from London Kings Cross along the
East Coast. Connections are made at York for journeys to
/ from Newcastle and Scotland. Call 0845 722 5225 for booking
CrossCountry trains run between Newcastle and Bristol (Temple
Meads), via Birmingham New Street. Some trains extend beyond
Bristol Temple Meads to Plymouth and/or Penzance. Others
run to/from Edinburgh, about 90 minutes beyond Newcastle.
Some trains operated by Midland MainLine start from and
terminate at Leeds. These trains run via Sheffield and Leicester
to London St. Pancras. Call 0345 125768 for MML booking
Arriva services run the local train services in West Yorkshire
on behalf of Metro. These services are faster and are generally
more comfortable for longer distance travel than the regular
